Posted By: LordRandomness (12/8/2011 3:55:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is the third incarnation of the Crovax, so I think that Crovax is the character with most cards that represent him...   
[Crovax the Cursed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crovax the Cursed)  
[Ascendant Evincar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ascendant Evincar)  
[Crovax, Ascendant Hero](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crovax, Ascendant Hero)  
  
I don't know which is the best, I think that they all play different... This is the weirdest, because I think that its second and third abilities aren't white at all, but hey, it's Planar Chaos, right? Especially its second ability... Sure white is racist!   
  
3.5/5

Posted By: RichardJesperson (9/4/2011 1:26:17 PM)

posts.post_content:
A bit late, but in response to jumpenrun: Unless stated otherwise, abilities of permanents only function while they're on the battlefield, so no, you can't use his ability from the graveyard. You can, however, use it in response to something that would kill him, in which case he never goes to the graveyard at all.  
  
 And since nobody else has mentioned it, he's rather outclassed now by [Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite), who costs only ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) more, and gets +1/+3 compared to him, has double the bonus/penalty, and benefits all your creatures and hurts all opponents' creatures, regardless of color.
posts.html:
A bit late, but in response to jumpenrun: Unless stated otherwise, abilities of permanents only function while they're on the battlefield, so no, you can't use his ability from the graveyard. You can, however, use it in response to something that would kill him, in which case he never goes to the graveyard at all.

And since nobody else has mentioned it, he's rather outclassed now by Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite, who costs only more, and gets +1/+3 compared to him, has double the bonus/penalty, and benefits all your creatures and hurts all opponents' creatures, regardless of color.
